1420544407300943872.text: Student debt cancellation is good policy, good politics, and something that @POTUS has the power to do with the stroke of his pen. We need him to use it.

1420544406390718467.text:
Asking “how we’re going to pay for it” misses the point. 

We should be asking how we’re going to pay for the status quo. 

We need to look at student loan cancellation as an investment, one that will pay dividends that benefit us all - including people who didn’t attend college.

1420544405493194760.text:
Student debt cancellation is also the single most effective way to reduce the racial wealth gap. Black and brown borrowers are forced to borrow more, at higher rates, than their white counterparts.

Cancelling student loan debt would close the Black-White wealth gap by 28 points.

1420544404595613700.text: By freeing people from the burden of student debt, we enable them to start families, buy homes, launch small businesses, and fully engage in our economy.

1420544403026874370.text:
Cancelling student debt isn’t just the right thing to do -- it’s the smart thing to do. 

According to leading economists, cancelling student debt would create over 1 million jobs per year.

1420544402091565056.text:
In fact, President Biden has already used this authority.

Just last month, he cancelled more than $500 million in student debt held by nearly 18,000 students defrauded by ITT Tech.

1420544401022013445.text:
What’s more, regulations issued by the Justice and Treasury Departments give the Secretary the clear authority “to compromise a debt, or suspend or terminate collection of a debt,” arising from a Title IV loan program. 

Title IV loans make up over 90% of student loan debt.

1420544400195731461.text:
The Higher Education Act gives the Secretary of Education the power to “enforce, pay, compromise, waive, or release any right, title, claim, lien, or demand, however acquired.”

In other words, it gives him the power to cancel any student debt held by the federal government.

1420544399277187073.text:
There’s been a lot of factually inaccurate talk about student debt cancellation today, so let’s clear a few things up.

President Biden has the clear authority to liberate 43 million Americans from the crushing burden of student debt. He needs to use it. 

🧵🧵

Here’s why this matters.

On three separate occasions, Congress changed the size of the Supreme Court to help defeat white supremacy.

Today's far-right majority has been reviving Jim Crow. We must learn from history and do what it takes to stop them.

We must #ExpandTheCourt.

1384991136184520704.text:
In 1869, Ulysses S. Grant succeeded Johnson. 

Grant strongly supported Reconstruction.

So Congress once again expanded the Court, to its current nine justices.

1384991135358193677.text:
Then in 1866, after Lincoln’s assassination, the white supremacist Andrew Johnson was President. A seat on the Court sat empty.

If Johnson filled it, the Court could have halted Reconstruction.

So Congress shrank the Court from 10 justices to 7, and Johnson never filled a seat.

1384991134498365440.text:
The year was 1861.

The Supreme Court was run by white supremacists who decided Dred Scott.

President Lincoln warned that if Congress didn’t check the Court, “the people will have ceased to be their own rulers.”

In 1863, Congress answered Lincoln’s call — expanding the Court.

1384991133000941574.text:
It’s not unprecedented for Congress to adjust the size of the Supreme Court to defeat white supremacy. We’ve done it three times before.

Here are some examples from our nation’s First Reconstruction. 🧵🧵 https://t.co/Kk6qzLgBbS

As an openly gay, Black American who grew up in Section 8 housing and on food stamps, these issues are not academic for me.

They are my lived experiences, and they reflect the experiences of countless others across the country.

Now, let’s get to work.

1340086583446433793.text:
In many states, it’s still legal to discriminate against LGBTQ+ people in housing, education, hiring, and even restrooms. Our legal system has yet to catch up with the progress we've made in public life.

We must pass the Equality Act and ensure equity for LGBTQ+ people.

1340086582515216386.text:
Our criminal legal system has decimated Black and brown communities. Many of us live in fear of police violence. Mass incarceration is out of control -- the United States incarcerates nearly 25% of the world’s prison population.

We must reimagine our criminal legal system.

1340086581651226627.text:
Outdated laws and a generation of unchecked mergers have ushered in a new gilded age. Facebook, Google, Apple, and Amazon have amassed monopoly power over our attention and our economy, and our democracy has paid the price.

We must break up, and regulate, Big Tech.

1340086579788963841.text:
The far right has spent decades on a hostile takeover of our federal courts. There is now a 6-3 hyper-partisan, conservative majority on the Supreme Court that favors big business over working people, and seeks to undermine our democracy.

1340086578379669504.text:
Our democracy is broken.

Voter suppression is rampant. People of color are systematically excluded from our political process. And due to unjust campaign finance laws, the wealthy and well-connected have outsize control over our political process.

We must restore our democracy.
